Brief Description (~20 words): median Gemini Apps text prompt emits 0.03 grams of carbon dioxide equivalent (gCO2e)
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: A tiny whisper of a carbon footprint: just 0.03 g of CO₂ per Gemini prompt. Blink and it’s gone.

Brief Description (~20 words): Average google search
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: A single Google search spits out 0.2 grams of CO₂. So yes, asking “What time is it?” online leaves a trace of carbon footprint.

Brief Description (~20 words): Mid sized chatgpt prompt
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Every prompt you send gives off 2 to 3 grams of CO₂. Small individually, but it adds up quickly while you chat nonstop!
Heating leftovers releases about 30 g of CO₂. Your microwave munchies come with a side of emissions.

Brief Description (~20 words): Average kettle has 1542 uses every year
Notes: 0.11 kWh per use based/1 Litre of water
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Boiling water emits about 47 grams of CO₂. Your tea time arrives with its own little carbon bill.
Your morning coffee takes about 50 g of CO₂. Energy, beans, and boiling water all leave their mark.

Item Name: Generating a smaller model image using AI
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Making a small AI image costs around 100 g of CO₂. That “quick” AI doodle isn’t as light as it looks.

Brief Description (~20 words): Mobile phones use electricity likely generated from power plants that emit carbon dioxide into the air
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Using your phone for an hour means around 172 g of CO₂. That’s a lot for casual doom-scrolling.

Notes: avg 408kWh per use, 24 hours a day
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: A fridge-freezer quietly hums out 175 g of CO₂ in a year. Keeping snacks cool still takes power.
One load of laundry produces about 273 g of CO₂. Your clothes get clean; the planet gets a bit dirtier.

Brief Description (~20 words): The average ten minute car ride with a gas car over 1.5 miles.
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: A short car ride burns through about 560 g of CO₂. Tiny trip, noticeable footprint.

Notes: avg 2.50kWh/per cycle with avg load of 4.67 kg dry laundry
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: A tumble-dry cycle pumps out around 930 g of CO₂. Fluffy clothes come at a cost.

Brief Description (~20 words): 1 roll 2 ply
(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: One toilet paper roll uses about 1,300 g of CO₂. Even wiping leaves a footprint.

A hot 10-minute shower gives off about 2 kg of CO₂. Relaxing for you, not so much for the atmosphere.
Cooling a typical U.S. home racks up roughly 2 kg of CO₂ each year. Comfort quietly consumes energy.

(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Watching your primary TV for a year emits about 215 kg of CO₂. Binge-watching is far from carbon-free.

(Tentative) "Lively style" Description?: Kylie Jenner’s 17-minute private-jet hop? A whole metric ton of CO₂. Yes, for 17 minutes.

GPT-3’s yearly emissions reach around 7.62 tons of CO₂. Quite the appetite for electricity.

Training GPT-4 reached about 5,184 tons of CO₂. Building the future of AI takes a lot of energy.
